title: How to Clean Stainmaster Carpet

steps.headline: Vacuum the dirt.
steps.description: First, you can remove a lot of the dirt with a vacuum cleaner. Then, you can tackle the remaining stains with soap and water.

steps.headline: Use soap and water on the stain.
steps.description: Mix water and ¼ cup (21 grams) of liquid soap into a spray bottle, and then spray this mixture directly onto the stain. Let it sit before rinsing it with warm water.

steps.headline: Use a vinegar-based carpet cleaner.
steps.description: If you cannot remove the stain with simply soap and water, try a homemade vinegar solution. Combine ¼ cup (21 g) baking soda, ¼ cup (21 g) white vinegar, and ½ cup (43 g) of warm water into a spray bottle. Spray this mixture directly onto the stained carpet. Allow it to sit for three to five minutes before rinsing off with warm water.

steps.headline: Use a paper towel or washcloth to remove the cleaner.
steps.description: Once you have let the cleaner sit for about 5 minutes, wipe it away using a clean washcloth or a few paper towels.

steps.headline: Soak up the spill with a paper towel.
steps.description: Take a paper towel or washcloth and remove all that you can by blotting at the stain. You may need more than one towel to do this thoroughly.

steps.headline: Apply a cleaning solution.
steps.description: There are many cleaning solutions designed specifically for removing pet waste from carpets, so look for one of these. Spray the solution onto the stain directly.

steps.headline: Give the solution time to soak into the rug.
steps.description: You should let the solution sit for at least 5 minutes, so that it has time to soak into the carpet’s fibers and remove the stain.

steps.headline: Rinse with cold water.
steps.description: After giving it time to soak, rinse the spot by blotting it with a water-soaked towel. Then, dab it dry it with a clean paper towel or washcloth.

steps.headline: Blot the stain with a paper towel.
steps.description: Use a dry towel or paper towel to dab the stain, removing all that you can in this manner. Avoid rubbing it into to the rug, since this could cause the stain to grow larger.

steps.headline: Add salt to the stain.
steps.description: If you cannot treat the stain immediately, sprinkle some salt to the area after blotting it clean. The salt can help to absorb the wine stain. When ready to treat the stain, simply vacuum the salt off of the carpet before beginning.

steps.headline: Create a mixture using soap and water.
steps.description: Mix together ¼ teaspoon (1.2 milliliter) of dish soap with one cup of warm water. Spray this directly onto the carpet, and let it sit for about five minutes before rinsing with warm water.

steps.headline: Use a stronger mixture of vinegar and water.
steps.description: If you are unable to remove the stain with soapy water, try using 2 tablespoons (29.6 ml) of white vinegar with warm water. Dab or spray this directly onto the stain. Then, rinse using a paper towel dampened with warm water.

text: Removing Dirt Vacuum the dirt. First, you can remove a lot of the dirt with a vacuum cleaner. Then, you can tackle the remaining stains with soap and water. Use soap and water on the stain. Mix water and ¼ cup (21 grams) of liquid soap into a spray bottle, and then spray this mixture directly onto the stain. Let it sit before rinsing it with warm water. Use a vinegar-based carpet cleaner. If you cannot remove the stain with simply soap and water, try a homemade vinegar solution. Combine ¼ cup (21 g) baking soda, ¼ cup (21 g) white vinegar, and ½ cup (43 g) of warm water into a spray bottle. Spray this mixture directly onto the stained carpet. Allow it to sit for three to five minutes before rinsing off with warm water. Use a paper towel or washcloth to remove the cleaner. Once you have let the cleaner sit for about 5 minutes, wipe it away using a clean washcloth or a few paper towels. Cleaning Pet Urine Soak up the spill with a paper towel. Take a paper towel or washcloth and remove all that you can by blotting at the stain. You may need more than one towel to do this thoroughly. Apply a cleaning solution. There are many cleaning solutions designed specifically for removing pet waste from carpets, so look for one of these. Spray the solution onto the stain directly. Give the solution time to soak into the rug. You should let the solution sit for at least 5 minutes, so that it has time to soak into the carpet’s fibers and remove the stain. Rinse with cold water. After giving it time to soak, rinse the spot by blotting it with a water-soaked towel. Then, dab it dry it with a clean paper towel or washcloth. Cleaning Wine Spills Blot the stain with a paper towel. Use a dry towel or paper towel to dab the stain, removing all that you can in this manner. Avoid rubbing it into to the rug, since this could cause the stain to grow larger. Add salt to the stain. If you cannot treat the stain immediately, sprinkle some salt to the area after blotting it clean. The salt can help to absorb the wine stain. When ready to treat the stain, simply vacuum the salt off of the carpet before beginning. Create a mixture using soap and water. Mix together ¼ teaspoon (1.2 milliliter) of dish soap with one cup of warm water. Spray this directly onto the carpet, and let it sit for about five minutes before rinsing with warm water. Use a stronger mixture of vinegar and water. If you are unable to remove the stain with soapy water, try using 2 tablespoons (29.6 ml) of white vinegar with warm water. Dab or spray this directly onto the stain. Then, rinse using a paper towel dampened with warm water.
